metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46873 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description: Because Firefox did not implement the unsafe-hashes CSPdirective, an attacker who was able to inject markup into a page otherwiseprotected by a Content Security Policy may have been able to injectexecutable script. This would be severely constrained by the specifiedContent Security Policy of the document. This vulnerability affects Firefox< 108. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46873` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
